thread.title: Apple Unveils Brand New iPhone With '3D Touch'
thread.title_full: Apple Unveils Brand New iPhone With '3D Touch'

title: Apple Unveils Brand New iPhone With '3D Touch'
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Sep 9, 2015, 20:29 BST - UK Markets closed Apple Unveils Brand New iPhone With '3D Touch' By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News â€“ 5 minutes ago View Photo 

Apple (NasdaqGS: AAPL - news ) chief executive Tim Cook has announced the latest iPhone range with a brand new screen system called '3D Touch'. 
The technology allows the screen to recognise how hard you're pressing on it, which means you can touch and hold parts of the screen at different pressure levels to give you access to context-sensitive in-app menus and shortcuts. 
For example you can "peek" at emails without fully opening them by pressing your finger down on an item in your inbox. 
During a demonstration, executive Craig Federighi showed how a hard press on the left-hand side of the screen will take you into the multitasking menu without having to double-tap the home button. 
The phones, which will be called the iPhone 6s and 6s Plus, will include an A9 processor, bringing better performance and better graphics. 
The main iSight camera is also significantly improved, going from eight megapixels to 12 megapixels. 
The front-facing camera has also been optimised for selfies. The screen now acts as 'flash', which varies in intensity depending on the light levels around you. 
Earlier, Mr Cook showed off a new iPad line, saying: "Today we have the biggest news in iPad since the iPad." 
He revealed a new device - called the iPad Pro - with an ultra-high resolution screen measuring 12.9-inches. 
Apple says the device has "desktop class" power, as well as a cover containing a "smart keyboard". 
A stylus which Apple is branding "Apple Pencil" is also being released which will work only on the iPad Pro model. 
The width of the Pro is the same as the height of the Air. It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) contains an A9X chip, making it 1.8 times faster than the iPad. 
Apple has also shown off its overhauled Apple TV service, with a redesigned remote featuring a glass surface, and Siri integration. 
Multiplayer gaming will also feature on the TV platform, and the developers of classic iOS game Crossy Road demonstrated their game on the system. 
They were followed on stage by developers from Harmonix, the creators of Rock Band, who are bringing a new game called Beat Sports exclusively to Apple TV. 
You'll also be able to shop on screen, and watch two video feeds side by side. 
However despite the raft of announcements, Apple's share price steadily fell during the presentation.
